intro: Strobilanthes hookeri var. glabra, commonly known as the silky strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
